name: SeaDataNet ODV4 ASCII format
description: Format for profiles, time series and trajectories, extended with a SeaDataNet semantic header.  The SeaDataNet ODV import format is a version of the ODV version 4 generic spreadsheet format modified with some of the flexibility removed and additional information required by SeaDataNet. Within the SeaDataNet Version 1 transaction process each CDI record maps to a single physical file in this format. The entity for the Version 1 CDI data model is defined as discrete profiles or instrument time series records. Consequently each physical file will contain data of a single ‘type’ (bottle, CTD, etc.) from a single station at the time of the transaction. The file format has been designed to be able to hold multiple SeaDataNet data objects within a single physical file providing they conform to the same logical structure (i.e. providing they contain the same data columns). The fundamental data model underlying the format is the spreadsheet: i.e. a collection of rows each having the same fixed number of columns. There are three different types of column: 1) Metadata columns; 2) Primary variable data columns (one column for the value plus one for the qualifying flag); 3) Data columns.  The ODV4 format can be used directly in the popular Ocean Data View (ODV) analysis and presentation software package, which is maintained and regularly extended with new functionalities.

additionalProperty.name: Bibliographic citation
additionalProperty.value: Lowry Roy, Fichaut Michele, Schlitzer Reiner, Maudire Gilbert, Bregent Sophie (2019). SeaDataNet. Datafile formats. ODV, MEDATLAS, NETCDF. DELIVERABLE D8.5. https://doi.org/10.13155/56547
